Module javaNeuralNetwork.main
Package neural_network.components

Class Network

java.lang.Object
neural_network.components.Network
public class Network extends Object
Class to represent the whole network.

  • Constructor Details

    • Network

      public Network(int numFeatures, int numHiddenLayers, List<Integer> neuronCounts)
      Minimal constructor - need to specify number of inputs, outputs and hidden layers.
      Parameters:
      numFeatures - The number of coordinates per datapoint.
      numHiddenLayers - The number of hidden Layers for the Network.
      neuronCounts - The number of Neurons in each hidden Layer.

    • Network

      public Network(int numFeatures, int numHiddenLayers, List<Integer> neuronCounts, int numClasses, double leak, double learningRate)
      Medium level constructor - for classification.
      Parameters:
      numFeatures - The number of coordinates per datapoint.
      numHiddenLayers - The number of hidden Layers for the Network.
      neuronCounts - The number of Neurons in each hidden Layer.
      numClasses - The number of classes for a classification task.
      leak - The leak for the LeakyReLU.
      learningRate - The learning rate of the Network.

    • Network

      public Network(int numFeatures, int numHiddenLayers, List<Integer> neuronCounts, int numClasses, double leak, double learningRate, boolean regression, boolean adaptive, double gamma, boolean heWeights)
      Most general constructor.
      Parameters:
      numFeatures - The number of coordinates per datapoint.
      numHiddenLayers - The number of hidden Layers for the Network.
      neuronCounts - The number of Neurons in each hidden Layer.
      numClasses - The number of classes for a classification task.
      leak - The leak for the LeakyReLU.
      learningRate - The learning rate of the Network.
      regression - Whether we are performing regression or not (false for classification).
      adaptive - Whether we wish to have an adaptive learningRate or not.
      gamma - The adaptive learning rate parameter.
      heWeights - Whether we wish to use He initialisation for the weights or not.

  • Method Details

    • forwardPassOneDatapoint

      public List<Double> forwardPassOneDatapoint(List<Double> x)
      Performs a forward pass for one datapoint, excluding the ground truth value. This method returns the predicted value in the final Neuron in the outputLayer.
      Parameters:
      x - The datapoint, with all features.
      Returns:
      The softmax probabilities of each class (for classification) or the predicted regression value (for regression).

    • calculatePreActivatedValue

      double calculatePreActivatedValue(Layer leftLayer, Neuron rightNeuron)
      Given a leftLayer and a rightNeuron, this calculates the activation function and value from the leftLayer and propagates this value to the rightNeuron.
      Parameters:
      leftLayer - The current left Layer in forward propagation.
      rightNeuron - The current right Neuron in forward propagation.
      Returns:
      The value returned by the transferFunction before activation.

    • activateOutputLayer

      List<Double> activateOutputLayer(List<Double> zOutputLayer)
      Activates the values from the outputLayer using the softmax activation function.
      Parameters:
      zOutputLayer - The pre-activated values from the output layer in a classification problem.
      Returns:
      The list of softmax probabilities.

    • storeGradientOfLoss

      public void storeGradientOfLoss(Edge edge, double target, boolean first)
      Calculates the gradient of the loss function with respect to one weight (assigned to the edge) based on the values at edges of future layers. One part of the back propagation process.
      Parameters:
      edge - The Edge containing the weight we are interested in.
      target - The target value for the final output neuron for this specific datapoint.
      first - Determines whether we find the bias gradient or not.

    • backPropagateWeight

      void backPropagateWeight(Edge edge)
      Uses the loss gradients of all datapoints (for this specific edge) to perform gradient descent and calculate a new weight for this edge.
      Parameters:
      edge - The Edge whose weight we are interested in updating.

    • backPropagateWeights

      public void backPropagateWeights()
      Back propagates all the weights of the network after one batch of datapoints has been passed through.

    • backPropagateBias

      void backPropagateBias(Neuron neuron)
      Uses the bias gradients of all datapoints (for this specific Neuron) to perform gradient descent and calculate a new bias for this Neuron.
      Parameters:
      neuron - The Neuron whose bias we are interested in updating.

    • backPropagateBiases

      public void backPropagateBiases()
      Back propagates all the biases of the network after one batch of datapoints has been passed through.

    • getNeuronCounts

      public List<Integer> getNeuronCounts()
      Getter method for all the neuron counts, for the input, hidden and output Layers.
      Returns:
      All neuron counts.

    • isRegressor

      public boolean isRegressor()
      Getter method for the regression parameter.
      Returns:
      true if we are doing regression, false otherwise.

    • getLayers

      public List<Layer> getLayers()
      Getter method for the layers.
      Returns:
      A list of all the layers of the Network.

    • getEdges

      public List<List<List<Edge>>> getEdges()
      Getter method for the edges.
      Returns:
      A copied list of all the edges of the Network.

    • setRandom

      static void setRandom(Random random)
      Setter method for random.
      Parameters:
      random - The new random. This can be used for mocking purposes.
